jol.types.table
Class Table

java.lang.Object
  jol.types.table.Table
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Table>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Aggregation, BasicTable, EventTable, Function, RefTable
public abstract class Table
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Table>

The interface that all table types must extend. A table is responsible for the storage of tuples with a specific schema. Tables provide insertion and deletion methods that are called by the query processor. Insertion and deletion calls store or remove the passed in tuples and return those tuples that actually modified the state of the table as delta sets.

          Listeners can be established on tables that are called whenever a set of tuples has been inserted or deleted.

force

public void force(Tuple tuple)
           throws UpdateException
Force insert the given tuple. This method is provided as a way to insure the insertion of a tuple. The routine sidesteps the delta Datalog semantics.

Parameters:
tuple - The tuple to force insert.
Throws:
UpdateException - Bad tuple.

insert

public TupleSet insert(TupleSet tuples,
                       TupleSet conflicts)
                throws UpdateException
Insert a set of tuples into this table. Primary key conflicts are not removed from the table but rather returned in the the @param conflicts argument.

Parameters:
tuples - The tuples to be inserted.
conflicts - Any primary key conflicts that arise.
Returns:
The delta set of tuples.
Throws:
UpdateException

delete

public TupleSet delete(TupleSet tuples)
                throws UpdateException
Remove the set of tuples from the table.

Returns:
The delta set of the delete tuples (a.k.a. the tuples that were actually deleted by this operation.)
Throws:
UpdateException
